title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 285.6 - Conduct of hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 285.6 - Conduct of hearing

State Regulations
(a) There shall be no right of appearance or of cross-examination except to board
members. (b) A board of inquiry
shall decide for itself whether witnesses are to be placed under
oath. (c) The return dates of
notices of public hearings and of subpoenas shall be fixed at the reasonable
discretion of the board. (d) Refusal of a witness at a hearing before a board of inquiry to answer any
question which has been ruled proper may be referred to the Industrial

Commissioner for such action as may be taken under section 406 of the Civil

Practice Act. (e) Contemptuous
conduct at any hearing before the board of inquiry shall be grounds for
exclusion from the hearing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
285.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
